description: Started to work with Golang and wrote two open-source libraries, Weasel and Vibe.
Started rewriting my portfolio in Astro.
Accepted into Appomattox Regional Governor's School for the Arts and Technology.
Started rewriting my first big software project, Bookwyrm (2.0), in Ruby on Rails.
Scored a 1270 on my SAT, with a 590 on math and a 680 on language arts.
Started working on a project with my uncle for travel recommendations and guides.
Wrote a dashboard in four weeks for my family to keep track of garden production, weather, eggs, and more using Electron, React, and TypeScript.
Finished writing my first big project, Bookwyrm.
Started experimenting with a Raspberry Pi.
Started homeschooling.
Started my first big project, Bookwyrm (1.0), for book reviews. I wrote it in React and JavaScript.
Started Zooming with my uncle every week to learn coding (mostly frontend development).
Did small prep course with Fullstack Academy for web development basics.
Did the Khan Academy courses on software development.
Started to get into coding with Scratch and Code.org.
Started working on a website using a drag and drop builder for National History Day.
Joined the school robotics club.
Started attending Manchester Middle School in the Center-based Gifted program.
Started attending Winterpock Elementary School in the Center-based Gifted program.
Won the ACSI math olympics in the computational field for fourth graders.
Joined the lego robotics club at my school.
Won the ACSI math olympics in the computational field for third graders.
Won second place in the ACSI spelling bee.
Started attending Richmond Christian School, where my dad was principal.
